website_summaries.verdict: Even with an impressive 27 by 16 inch platform and telescoping handle that adjusts to the size of the user, this sturdy model still collapses into a thin 3.5 inches for easy storage.
pros: Telescoping handle extends up to 36 inches, allowing for users of all sizes to move items comfortably
300-pound capacity handles the items of the average user
Folds into a thin unit in spite of large platform and telescoping handle
Compact enough to store in virtually any utility closet
cons: Cart works best on flat surfaces, and wheels may wear out quickly if used often on rough terrain

website_summaries.verdict: A high-end platform truck that is simple to use and constructed to last.
pros: Foldable platform truck can be taken just about anywhere
Easy to open and close in just seconds
Telescoping handle enables you to seamlessly move the platform truck
Can be used to carry loads up to 300 pounds
cons: Assembly instructions may be tough to understand

customer_reviews.title: Don’t laugh - I used for an injured dog
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a highly functional and useful and easy to use trolly. It needed to serve two purposes - first was to move my injured dog around house with me (don’t laugh; we like being together). It swivels and it’s the perfect size. Next, I wanted it to move heavy duty items and easily store away once dog was healed. It was perfect. Folds down easily. My boyfriend laughed at first but saw it’s use. We like it. Dog is better by the way.
customer_reviews.author: Posting some thoughts

customer_reviews.title: Great find.
customer_reviews.text: This little cart has made my travel to dog competitions so much more easy. I love it. Sorry about the photo being sideways, this program doesn't let me edit. But I have two dogs in a crate, a folding chair, a tote, a lunchbox and my purse loaded on the cart and secured with bungee cords. Easiest trip I ever made from the parking lot to the event location. Super on pavement, but will navigate gravel road and low grass with a little more effort. Best part, it folds down and fits in the Prius :)
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Wells

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS. Keep shopping. Mine broke after less than 12 uses.
customer_reviews.text: After using it less than a dozen times, the handle stopped folding down. It's pretty much worthless to me because it can't fold up and fit in my car. I am seriously disappointed. Update! I went to the company's website and went to the warranty PDF. The warranty is one year and it listed three people to contact. So I sent emails to them. All bounced back as undeliverable. I was willing to change my review if the company would have stood behind its product, but obviously it doesn't care enough to update contact information on its warranty. Save your money and avoid frustration. Find another cart to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S.

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE INSTRUCTIONS BE CAREFUL
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions exactly. Hold both red buttons together and then lift up the bar. As I lifted up the bar, my pinky got stuck and I could not remove it! I had to break apart the cart and use oil to remove it!
customer_reviews.author: Papi

customer_reviews.title: I actually like this cart besides the fact it was very difficult ...
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to collapse handle flush with the cart. I actually like this cart besides the fact it was very difficult to collapse. I replaced the first one I ordered thinking it was a dud but but the replacement had the same issues. I originally purchased this on the recommendation of all the good Amazon reviews - sorry to have to leave a bad review.
customer_reviews.author: SuzyQ

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver & compact in a high-rise apartment!
customer_reviews.text: Has been a lifesaver! It stores rather compact with the wheels tucking into the base. The handle telescopes to 3-settings, and when you’re done it easily folds into the frame. NOTE: the handle must pop up for the wheels to lock. I’ve tipped it back to use as a dolly and it works fine. The front wheels are fixed, the wheels by the handle rotate. Weight capacity: 300 Lbs. Measures: 26.” Long (including the handle area) **24” with the handle obstructing. 16” wide (~2x sheets of paper side by side) 7.5” tall to The top of the base from the floor (including wheels extended)
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Extremely happy with this cart 👍
customer_reviews.text: I’m really impressed with this cart. I read a lot of reviews of many carts and landed on this one and I’m glad I did. One thing I like is how compact it is when folded but the best thing about it is how smoothly it rolls. I bought it to set my vertical standing electric pressure washer on because it tipped over all the time and was able to strap it to the cart handle. This cart is so easy to push or pull with the PW on it - even through grass when using around the yard to pressure wash block and other stuff. Well worth the cost and I expect it to last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Spends-a-lot

customer_reviews.title: I would rather push a load then pull a load
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would work for me but it doesn’t. You can really only pull it NOT push it. The front wheels are fixed and take you sideways when pushing forcing you to redirect it often. The actual handle will not handle that redirecting much because it’s fragile. You can’t stack upwards because again, the handle is fragile. I don’t see 100lbs on it without the handle breaking. You’ll definitely need the bungee cords that’s advertised as what people brought with it. It’s narrow and remember it has no sides. You can’t use it like a dolly because the handle will break. For the cost I wouldn’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: MovieNight

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Is it flimsy cheapie feeling cart? YES! Is it professional grade cart that's designed to be a workhorse? NO! Handle location and way the cart is designed isn't so friendly and I keep kicking it with my feet, hurting my toes too.... BUT if you're looking for a cheap, folding cart that you'll use once in a while, this is PERFECT! It does what it supposed to do and it makes moving boxes so much easier. But i would not buy this for everyday work need or anything like that. Definitely a 4 star product for regular home use who'll only use this once in a while!
customer_reviews.author: DEP

customer_reviews.title: Manga Cart
customer_reviews.text: This is an impressive cart. Love the easy fold. Here are my issues. When pushing the cart, with you behind the handle, the cart is very difficult to maneuver. It waddles and zig zags. When pulling the cart, with you in front of the handle and the cart behind you, the cart maneuvers perfectly. It has something to do with the wheels. You also have to make sure to keep your cargo well balanced in terms of weight distribution. This cart has turned over on me a few times. This cart can hold 300lbs, but I wouldn’t put that to the test. This can handle a few boxes here and there; light cargo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Don't you even think about taking my little cart away from me
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I use it all the time when I buy groceries and need to get them in the elevator and up to my unit. I recently helped a friend move and this little cart saved the day. It helped us move boxes and save my friend several hundred on hiring movers. The fold-ability is great. I keep it in my car so its ready when I need to save my back and haul a hundred pounds or so. Bet I would have spent hundreds at a chiropractor if I didn't buy this cart. Its a Truck actually, but people think you are talking about a drivable truck if you call it a Truck.
customer_reviews.author: James Quin

customer_reviews.title: Finally have a more compact cart
customer_reviews.text: I needed a smaller cart for my events. I was previously using a "regular" metal upright dolly, which was fine, but not always easy to find room for it in my vehicle. Saw a friend using this cart at an event and I just had to get one. I've used it at four shows so far and it works great. Can carry a lot of stuff and is fairly easy to maneuver. best part is that it collapses to a much smaller footprint so it now fits into my vehicle with plenty of room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Miracleman

customer_reviews.title: Easier to pull than push.
customer_reviews.text: Opens right up so there's and easy of assembly is not an issue. Really like the telescoping handle. I set it about waist high and it rolls right along behind me. Rolls beautifully. Haven't tested the weight limit and probably won't need to. You can definitely push it instead, but the wheels that rotate are beneath the handle and the ones that are fixed are on the other end, so turning is more easily done when pulling. That's really my only criticism but it's not a deal breaker. Rotating wheels on both ends would seem to make more sense. Seems to be well-built.
customer_reviews.author: OLDteacher

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and compact
customer_reviews.text: I've used this cart daily for a couple of months now and I really like it. It folds up very small and flat, doesn't weigh much, and can be folded and unfolded with one hand/motion. It's very steady and the base is wide enough to put big crates on. I wish that the handle was a little taller - even extended all the way it isn't very tall. It's not useful over rough surfaces so if you're off-roading or camping it's not your best bet, but for moving stuff inside or over pavement, it's a great little cart.
customer_reviews.author: MaryEllen

customer_reviews.title: High quality, compact, convenient folding, good for tough heavy loads.
customer_reviews.text: It's great how this folds right up, and it's tough enough to carry quite a lot of different loads. It's a little pricey, but I can easily understand where the cost is going, and it feels worth it. Edit: After having used it for quite some time, I have to change my rating of this product due to one fundamental flaw. The handle is too short so it is very easy to scrape your own feet/ankles while pulling a load.
customer_reviews.author: GJY

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Folding Platform Cart
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Magna Flatform Folding Platform Truck about 10 years ago and it still works amazing. I love this cart I use it just about daily. What I like most is how much it can hold and how easy it is to move heavy items. I keep it in my garage for easy access and use it to bring in groceries every week. I've used it to move furniture effortlessly around the house when I'm reorganizing. I loved this cart so much, I bought another one for my elderly mom who uses around the house to move just about everything! She loves how easy it is to open and fold back up then store in a neat small space.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brainerd

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, stable, easy to open/close to store flat
customer_reviews.text: I got these for work as my group hauls a lot of material between floors in the building and between labs in different buildings. The carts are rated for up to 500 lb loads. Cart is low to the ground, so it's stable and we don't worry about risk of cart + load having a high CG, being top heavy and falling over on someone. The card is easy to open and easy to close to store flat. Stole this idea from our packaging design group who have similar smaller carts (up to 300 lbs) and are constantly moving heavy loads all over the campus. Their carts have lasted them for many years with no issue
customer_reviews.author: ShoeLover9989

customer_reviews.title: So glad I spent the time looking
customer_reviews.text: I spent over two hours searching for what I needed. So glad I did and so happy with this product. I wanted a small platform to place a trash bag and wheel out for collection day. I was tired of struggling with a heavy bag out to the curb. This cart is exactly what I was hoping for. Perfect size for large trash bag, no assembly and it easily glides on grass. I took it out of the box, unfolded the handle and the wheel deployed like landing gear. Wow! It has a plastic platform with aluminum handle. I would think it will be ok to leave outside and hope it lasts. If so, it is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Betty A.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, folding workhorse
customer_reviews.text: The light-duty version of this folding cart served me well for 5 years until one of the rotating wheels got bent on a transition between surfaces. To replace it I opted for the larger cart because I wanted a longer bed and higher capacity. This XL version is significantly larger (as you can see in the photo)...but it is also much HEAVIER. It will do the job that I need, but it is at the limit of something you can carry and toss in the trunk. OK for me, but my wife finds it almost unusable because of the weight. So 5-star for me because I don't care that it's heavy; probably 2-star for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: S. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: BEST CART!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help take my sewing and scrapping supplies into retreats. It fit all the needs I had for it. I bought bungie straps to help hold items on when going over a bump. I was able to get two 31 Utility totes on the platform and then stack on top of those. It is not heavy. It folds up easily with the wheels tucking under as you fold the handle down. It's about 4" wide when folded. I highly recommend it and would buy it again if mine was ever lost or stolen. Several people saw mine at our last retreat and were asking where I got it. You will not be disappointed with this cart.
customer_reviews.author: Jolene Hardin

customer_reviews.title: She Loved It !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my daughter in law. Our family is very involved in a particular competition sport, so they travel quite a bit. Needless to say, whether they're near or far, there's tons of sports gear, kid's stuff, and family items, which have to be unloaded at the event, reloaded, then taken to the hotel, etc. My D-in-L had seen these carts in action, and REALLY wanted one. So we compared many types online, and found this one to be strong and better designed than many others. I gave it to her for Christmas. and she has been truly thrilled with this cart ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Dreams

customer_reviews.title: LIFESAVER
customer_reviews.text: So this thing is amazing. It folds up fairly small, very easy to keep in your trunk or whatever and barely takes up space. This thing is durable and can carry a LOT of weight. It's the perfect size to carry almost anything. Bags of soil, storage bins, 5 gallon buckets, etc. My girlfriend and I do craft shows and work at conventions and stuff and bought this to help with that and seriously, with some straps you can stack like 4 storage bins on this thing and it carries them like it was nothing. I wish I had gotten one of these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Andy G

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to store quality flat cart that can handle the weight you put on it!
customer_reviews.text: PROS: By far the best cart I have owned! I bought it for an upcoming move, but it's already proven useful in loading/unloading heavy things from my car as I get ready for the move. The rubber wheels are well built and make it easy to maneuver the cart over uneven surfaces and around corners. I have used it with and without a container and either way it works very well and best of all (unlike basket carts) it folds flat and is easily stored in small spaces. I will be using this cart regularly for a long-time to come! : ) CONS: None!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver. Solid, and well built.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second. Love it. Very solid. Rolls well, folds well - and very flat. The ball bearings started coming out of one of the wheels on my first one, but it moved me twice across the country, and was also used to load in/out photography equipment on my gigs - so I don't blame the design. Note*: you've gotta have a straight run and elevators for this.. unlike a hand truck which you can pull up steps, this must be unloaded and reloaded at any step, or stairway without a ramp (which should be obvious for a 4 wheel cart - but I mention it anyway)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy construction and NO ASSEMBLY!
customer_reviews.text: Happy with purchase. Fast delivery. Sturdy construction, perfect size and weight for my needs. Takes a little getting used to the swivel wheels being at the back instead of the front, but not an issue for me. Opens and closes easily. When unfolding handle make sure to pull back the handle until your hear a click; means handle and wheels have clicked in place. Also when loading the flatbed make sure to even out the weight so that the front of the flatbed is a little heavier otherwise the cart will tip backwards. (Yes, happened to me! ) The "no assembly" feature was the deciding factor in my purchasing this flatform cart. :)
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: So close to being perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Great cart. Well built and operates perfectly, HOWEVER... I assumed that the plastic tote was included. I wanted something to handle my Amazon deliveries that was waterproof because I am disabled and have had several drug deliveries that were left in the rain. One item was injectable meds. No where in the description that said that the item, the plastic tote seen in the pictures, wasn’t included. It’s a little frustrating because I am a 100% disabled Viet Nam veteran and all the work and aggravation doesn’t help with my issues. I’m happy with everything else.
customer_reviews.author: FarmAnimal

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality! Wheel bent beyond repair after a few ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality! Wheel bent beyond repair after a few uses. Didn't even put HALF the weight capacity on it. Only put 130 lbs and it broke! Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Wrex

customer_reviews.title: awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best cart ever...seriously. I like that it folds flat for compact storage, since the wheels also fold in it takes up only about 2-1/2" of space. I just put it on the floor of my trunk so its always available when I need it. Its easy to use just takes a couple of seconds and you're ready to go. Its very strong and sturdy, I have used it to move 4 cases of costco bottled water and it worked perfectly. The platform is flat and smooth so you can put just about anything on it,
customer_reviews.author: daisy lani

customer_reviews.title: Love this little cart!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a light weight, yet very sturdy cart, look no further. This cart folds down nicely without the wheels getting in the way. I frequently cart around fairly heavy craft equipment and this product makes going from place to place a breeze. It is great for my small business and I also use it around the house when I need a little assist moving things to and from my back yard and garage.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Finally found the right cart for my hauling needs!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought and tried several carts and none of them performed like this one! One of my favorite features is how it folds down to practically nothing. When I go to shows my car is packed, barely room for anything but merchandise, so I needed a cart that would take up valuable room. This is is. And my most favorite feature is that the handle extends up for somebody tall like me. My other carts are awkward to push or pull, I have to hunch over to reach the handle, but this one is perfect! Can't believe I got this at such a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Malynda McCarrick

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly useful for moving in or out of an apartment building
customer_reviews.text: This platform hand-truck is extremely useful when you are moving in or out of an apartment. We didn't have it for the prior move but only for our most recent one. What a difference it makes to have your own dolly, especially when moving in Covid-times when you are trying to minimize contact and streamline everything you do. This moving truck was a godsend. We also used it to transport heavy shelving several blocks on the street. It's sturdy and easy to maneuver (pull it, handlebar first... that works better than pushing it). Great product.
customer_reviews.author: C. Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, durable, light but tough!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a pharmacy courier so this thing takes a serious beating 5 days a week. Sometimes his loads are as big 5 ft tall and full all around. This does the job for the biggest loads. I recommend bundgy cords to keep things from falling off. Very easy to maneuver. It collapse very nice making it easy to stow in our sedan. It’s light and small but so efficient! For the work my husband does, this is so much better than a dolly which takes a lot of space in a trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Mary J.

customer_reviews.title: Best cart for the price
customer_reviews.text: The Magna Cart is great for its price. The cart isn't too big and it's not too small. This is perfect for people who live in condos or apartments and go to Costco a lot. When you pull the cart out the box it is flat and perfect for something to leave in the car without taking up to much space. When you need it, it takes two simple steps for it to become a cart and it takes 3 steps to collapse the cart. I have nothing negative to say about this cart. When you roll the cart it is smooth and easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Jin

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this cart before we moved into our apartment. It has been worth its weight in gold. We have used this almost everyday to transport purchases from the car to the apartment and moving boxes to storage. It has been so good we purchased one for my in-laws and my mom. The handle and wheels fold in nice for compact storage. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Rose

customer_reviews.title: Compact and heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: This cart is exactly what I needed for moving my heavy wedding cakes from the car to the table. I chose this because I used my sister's just like it. I had been researching different carts but was most impressed with the weight allowance and especially how it folds compactly, including the wheels. My only complaint might be that many of the others came with a bungee. It's not a big deal, since I have several. It just would be nice if one was included.
customer_reviews.author: NaNavyMom

customer_reviews.title: Best cart ever!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't remember the last time I bought a product that gave me this much quality for such a low price. As a filmmaker I use this thing almost daily and put hundreds of pounds on it and it keeps plugging away. I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: V. CrofootTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good idea that doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, but lacks execution in product manufacturing. Bought one for myself, then another for my wife and finally two more for the office in rapid succession; then they started breaking. Only have one left working; the same part breaks in each case, so a definite flaw with the design. And, you can't get replacement parts..... If they ever redesign, might be a good product, but until then, shop for something else.
customer_reviews.author: mattvs

customer_reviews.title: My big helper
customer_reviews.text: I love this cart. I live in an apartment building. I get groceries delivered. I meet the delivery person in the lobby. Put a big plastic bin on the cart and my groceries are back in my apt in a flash. It's easy to set up and folds really flat for easy storage. I don't know how I managed so long without it. But now, I'd fight you for it. It's also helpful going to the laundry room or to pick up package deliveries from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Micky

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This cart is worth the money that I spent on it. It rolls easily. It will carry what I need it to carry. The only reason that I did not rate as a 5 star is because it is a bit difficult to close. When I attempt to fold flat it takes a great deal of hand strength to disengage the lock and have the wheels rotate into position for storage.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Cart
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic cart that is perfect if you live in a high rise apartment building. I use this cart to carry groceries, packages, small furniture, and just about everything else from the parking garage to my apartment. The cart rolls well. The handle is good. The flat bed is large enough to hold most household items and small furniture. The cart folds flat so you can put it in your car. Note, the cart is a little heavy to carry. It's better to roll it. So many of my neighbors have ordered this cart after seeing mine. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: This is a GREAT cart with many uses!!!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this to help with moving when my daughter went off to college and moved into the third floor of her dorm. It was a life saver. I am a teacher and have used it MANY times since then to move things from my car to my classroom. The price was great and it is a great cart to have on hand. I also love that it folds totally flat. I keep it in the back of my SUV so it is always there when I need it and since it is flat, it doesn't really take up any room back there!
customer_reviews.author: Arts and Crafts Gal

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE the Magna Flatform Cart
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Magna Flatform cart that I have purchased. I LOVE THIS CART. I have done lots of research, and there is no other cart that out there that will compact itself into a nice flat piece. The handle fits nicely into the cart and the wheels flip inward allowing the cart to be completely flat. The cart is light weight and yet still sturdy. Bungee cords are a must for this cart as they allow you to attach anything and everything but hooking the cords to the bottom and sides of the cart. What a great design.
customer_reviews.author: Yellow Bird

customer_reviews.title: Very useful for seniors with balance disorders
customer_reviews.text: I have a balance disorder because of peripheral neuropathy in my legs and feet. Since I am at high risk for falling down, I cannot carry anything from one room to another using both hands. I need to reserve one hand for a cane. If an object requires two hand carry, I can put it on this hand truck and wheel it from one room to another. (It takes two hands to put the object on the hand truck, but I can use two hands if I lean against something while I am doing it.) This hand truck would rather roll on concrete or wood floors, but I can roll it on my rug OK.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: We have used these for years! Absolutely worth investing in! We use them on a daily bases to move things from the car to the units, from one building to the next. Super convenient to collapse flat and opens quickly and effortlessly. Very quality and durable! They really can hold a lot of weight and move efficiently. Own three of them currently. Would recommend to everyone and anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Tai

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as implied
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cart primarily to help me with jobs around the house outside. It does not wheel well over sidewalk; and doesn't wheel at all over dirt or landscaping rock. I tried to haul landscaping brick to the backyard, got stuck in the dirt. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: instrumentforhim

customer_reviews.title: This thing made an event possible for me
customer_reviews.text: After all of my helping hands dropped out and I had to get all my gear moved in and out of an event myself, this kart made that possible for me. Very sturdy, I'm pretty sure i loaded it near capacity and it handled like a champ. The video provided in the sale shows it's exactly as simple as that. Which it was maybe a little taller but honestly this thing is a really handy tool if you're going to be moving a lot of gear solo.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew E.

customer_reviews.title: NO BS!  Avoid back problems, get a Flatform hand truck for home or business
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use, fold up and store. 300# capacity with easy maneuverability. My neighbor uses several for his business. I took one to work on my mom's house, and even my sister could easily maneuver it. She can't weigh much more than 100#. She was overjoyed when I gave her one for her birthday. Good for yard work too. Oh, and I even take my Flatform camping, to carry ice chests, food storage containers, etc.
customer_reviews.author: L. Eskaldun

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, held up under lots of weight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this right before my recent move - wanted something to help move items from the moving pod into my apartment (since the pod could not rk immediately by my apartment). Very sturdy, held up under lots of weight, and since it folds up, I keep it in my car trunk and it has come in handy numerous times since the move. My back thanks me as minimizes how much heavy stuff I carry around. Even taking in teh groceries - load the bags up and roll thm inside. It is wonderful. VERY sturdy construction and does not take up much room at all once folded flat.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: folding mechanism defective.
customer_reviews.text: Actually, the product was wonderful, when it worked, but it only worked twice before the folding mechanism jammed. I used it in December, folded it away, and tried to use it again in late February. It opened beautifully, but will not fold again. The item is no longer working, and because i have had it four months, i can no longer return it.
customer_reviews.author: Workforce Investment Board of Will County

customer_reviews.title: REALLY happy with this
customer_reviews.text: It's very sturdy and the perfect size for us; the platform holds four book-boxes perfectly, and that's mostly what we haul. Also, assembly took about 30 seconds. I wish the handle were a bit more bungie-cord friendly, as one does need to secure the load, and....and there isn't really anything to secure it to. But we will persevere, and boy, it beats all heck out of our old upright hand-truck.
customer_reviews.author: Topkat2

customer_reviews.title: LIFE SAVER if you're moving!
customer_reviews.text: We were moving out of an apartment in a small city, and there is absolutely NO WAY that we would have finished as quickly (and with zero back injuries!) as we did without this cart. This thing muscled through uneven pavement carrying heavy tupperware bins filled with probably 150-200 pounds at a time, and still handled like a dream. It's instantaneous to fold and unfold, and packs down small enough to fit into a fully loaded Honda Civic. I wish I'd bought this sooner for groceries!!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra L.

customer_reviews.title: Speedy arrival.
customer_reviews.text: My neighbor has had a Flatform folding cart for years and I finally got one. It’s just as I had seen and used hers for. It arrived within days of ordering which surprised me also. It’s so easy to handle taking back and forth to the car and Into the trunk. I’m 72 years and It’s easy to handle, so the investment is good even though I paid quite a bit more than my neighbor did.
customer_reviews.author: Kathlene

customer_reviews.title: Decent balance between function and handling
customer_reviews.text: This dolly requires no assembly and the direction is easy to follow. The size is good for personal use. The weight is not light but manageable. It's better to put items inside a big tub. If not, they roll off. Also, it seems that I can't push this hand truck. I have to pull it behind me to make it stay on a straight line. The handle height is rather limited. It's barely high enough for me (5'3").
customer_reviews.author: Anony MouseTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Moves so easily!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to move cat carriers in and out of show halls, etc. It works great! I can load two carriers (with a rubber mat in between to prevent slipping), a grooming box and a cooler - all strapped down with bungee cords. It moves easily over all types of parking lots, and turns easily maneuvering in the show hall or hotel rooms. My husband uses it for moving things around the garage, etc. Loves how easy it is to fold up and put in the trunk.
customer_reviews.author: E. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Love this cart! But very pricey...
customer_reviews.text: This cart is PERFECT for hauling in our crates of groceries (we have a long walk from the car to the house and have two kids to wield as well). I like that it folds up all the way so it doesn’t take up space and my toddler can’t unfold it and use it like a scooter. :) Only issue is that this is quite expensive compared to other carts out there. We’ve almost returned it due to the cost...
customer_reviews.author: Christi Guth

customer_reviews.title: Love my Magna Cart
customer_reviews.text: I recently moved to a high rise and noticed another tenant with this cart to bring stuff up from his car. I ordered it right away. It's heavier than I expected, but sturdy and has been useful for bringing large loads up to the apartment. The wheels and handle tuck in to allow it to fold flat, but is still a few inches high. I keep it in the car trunk where it doesn't take up much space and is always with me to use. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Larry218

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Fold Cart
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this cart 5 stars, but when it arrived one of the tabs that are used to release the lock to unfold and fold it up was broken. It is still functional. (Thank goodness for small hands, as I can reach in the crack to slide what is left of the tab.) Love the cart itself. We used it to move a couch and loveseat. It worked great! It is very sturdy and moves smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Billzer

customer_reviews.title: Being that the weight capacity for this dolly is listed as 300lbs and it feels sturdy, I don't understand how this has happened
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the above folding dolly and within a few short months it started having all kinds of issues. The first of which was that the right hand wheels will not fold flat anymore unless I hold the release and jam the wheels flat. It's very frustrating. With that said, I was willing to work with that issue, but now the dolly barely rolls even when the wheels are in the properly locked position. Being that the weight capacity for this dolly is listed as 300lbs and it feels sturdy, I don't understand how this has happened. I run a small apparel company and we just move boxes of shirts around.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Paton

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Was able to easily transport a 58-pound mini-fridge with 21-pound microwave set on top of it. Very quick and simple to unfold it to use and to fold back up after use. Very sturdy. On the heavy side to carry when folded up (I think it's 15 pounds?) but that's why it's so durable and good quality, and it does have a convenient carry handle in it. It works perfectly on smooth asphalt/other surfaces, but the wheels get stuck when the floor/surface isn't flat (hence 4 star rating instead of 5). Overall a great purchase and great price!
customer_reviews.author: bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I am a mobile DJ and I purchased this cart to help with moving 35+lb powered speakers and other gear from the vehicle to the venue and back. It gets the job done! The cart itself weighs over 30lbs. It seems pretty sturdy. I would also use bungee cords to help secure items on the cart so that they don't bounce off while rolling over rough or uneven surface.
customer_reviews.author: Educ8YourMind

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this cart! This had made my life SO much easier! I use it to pack and unpack my classroom, carry packages up to my apartment via elevator, and it helped me move into my new place. So far so good! The wheels are super smooth and it turns like a dream in tight spaces with bulky packages.
customer_reviews.author: Justpeachy85

customer_reviews.title: Folding this cart takes more muscle than realized!
customer_reviews.text: This cart is for light duty and or transfers. I had wanted to utilize for moving out of a one bedroom apartment. Wanting to bring boxes down to my car. It turned out to be quite time consuming. This size cart is for around the house kind of maneuvering.
customer_reviews.author: CASS

customer_reviews.title: Handy Little Cart
customer_reviews.text: This little cart is just the thing I needed for our apartment since we do not have a lot of space to store things. It's easy to fold flat and unfold, once you learn how. I've only used it a few times so far, and have not hauled anything even approaching 300 lbs. However, I've hauled about 100 lbs on it without problem. It's not too heavy to lift into the car, and fits nicely between the front and back seat. The tires are firm, but soft enough that they roll nicely over rough asphalt pavement.
customer_reviews.author: Donald R. Green

customer_reviews.title: it's the antithesis of a space hog
customer_reviews.text: works great, very portable. instructions brief and vague, but ultimately dercpherable. 2 design flaws: needs a brake--there is no stopping it or holding it still while you're trying to load. be sure to unload from the handle end first--or else it falls backwards--bad balance that way
customer_reviews.author: H MEMPHIS JONES

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient, and easy to handle when folded flat. Unfolding it always gets a lot of attention from my (easily amused) friends. (Refolding it takes about three hands, though.} I haven't owned it long enough to know whether it's going to hold up, but it's worth it to me just for amusement value, and so far it's been very handy indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Rocketeer

customer_reviews.title: Practical
customer_reviews.text: Practical for those who need to go to the post office all the time. I can load up about 8 - 15 boxes on it easily. It took a while to figure out how to close it at first, but once you get the hang of it, it’s only 10 seconds of work to fold it closed and close the trunk of my car. I thought it was priced a bit high at first, but now I see it’s definitely worth it given the sturdy quality and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish I bought it years ago...
customer_reviews.text: After years of hauling things around for school and kids activities, I finally broke down and bought this. I LOVE it!!! It folds up nicely and fits nicely with all the things we are hauling in our hatchback. It's not too heavy and there are build in holds to help you carry it when it is folded up. It rolls nicely. Really, I can't think of what not to like. Get it -- your back will thank you too!!
customer_reviews.author: Purple Platypus

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: I use this for Amazon Flex deliveries. It folds down and takes almost no space in my trunk, but when needed, I can load it up with a dozen boxes. Along with a large bag to hold smaller envelopes, this has saved me from making multiple trips on numerous occasions. It rolls easily, carries a heavy load, and folds and deploys quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Ron B

customer_reviews.title: Best cart ever
customer_reviews.text: I love this cart, especially how it folds up so easily. It's light, carries and fits my light bag, camera bag, and tripod with no problem or overhang. I use this when taking my equipment to stores or locations to shoot video and its great, especially for the low price. Best features and design I could find anywhere, I would totally buy another if I ever need one.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Williams-Mele

customer_reviews.title: Quality product in compact package
customer_reviews.text: This is actually the second cart that I have purchased. My wife and I do craft shows and most of the products are glass and are wrapped in bubble wrap when we transport. We pack the product in plastic tubs with lids and can stack 4 at a time for moving them from the car to the show room. The sturdiness of the cart is immediately obvious. The fact that the whole unit folds into a flat shape makes packing it a dream. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: only two wheel swivel
customer_reviews.text: Its a smooth running cart and nicely built. It does collapse easily but not 100% smoothly. My biggest beef with it is that it was advertised as having Four 4" Rubber swivel wheels for easy mobility. Unfortunately it does not, only the two front wheels(handle side) swivel.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Ussel

customer_reviews.title: Handy Cart!
customer_reviews.text: Other complain this cart does not hold up. I have had no problem with mine, which I have had for about six months, although I am intentionally gentle folding and unfolding. I keep it in my trunk and use it to transport the groceries and other large items from the car to elevator to condo. More sturdy than the community luggage rack and I don't have to wait if another resident is using because I have this one stowed away, ready to unfold and roll. Besides groceries, I have use this to move patio lemon and lime trees and my other planters. So handy - useful purshase.
customer_reviews.author: Snapper

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cart for multi uses!
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased one of these for my retail store for moving things around and taking out stuff to the dumpster. It works so well and some of our delivery guys use it as well. I liked it so much that I purchased one for my own personal use. It folds down flat, stores easily in the back hatch of my SUV and so handy when I am unloading groceries etc. Not that expensive and it is durable, lightweight and doesn't take up a lot of space. WINNER!
customer_reviews.author: too busy to shop in stores

customer_reviews.title: Everyone loves my cart!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I purchased. The first one lasted five years but the handle can’t manage too much weight. I haul groceries with my cart.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Great cart!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, maneuvers easily and holds a LOT! Only reason I can't give it 5 stars, is the handle doesn't tilt out. It stays straight up. My fault, though, for not making sure before purchasing. But, it works wonderfully for toting all my vendor event equipment/supplies! A little heavy, but I wanted it to be sturdy. Folds/opens up very easily and rolls super smooth!!
customer_reviews.author: jchambers

customer_reviews.title: Can I give more than 5 stars?
customer_reviews.text: I would give this more than 5 stars if I could. One second set up and take down and I can't even put a cardboard banker's box together without help. I am not mechanical, have no patience for stuff that isn't idiot proof. Super sturdy. Love that it folds completely flat (the wheels even fold in). Give this designer a raise! I put it right back in the box it shipped in for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to fault
customer_reviews.text: It soHard to open and close in theory it seems great and when it works great but I will use mine a handful of times and I have to constantly jerk around the handle up and down up and down over and over again so it’s a great product in theory it just won’t last long and it’s gonna take you a long time to have to mess with it
customer_reviews.author: th13thstar

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cart. Best I’ve owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the best cart I’ve owned. I’ve bought three different ones before, trying to find something that worked well, and held boxes of files and this is the only one that actually did the job. I keep it in my truck and use it constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Zori

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: Good cart. I like that it is light and is foldable. Only down side is I think the handle bars should have been installed on the other side. The wheels by where the handle bar is located. Those wheels turn and makes it difficult to turn and makes the cart better if yoru dragging it instead of pushing it. If the handles were on the opposite and the front wheels turn. It would be a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You will be so glad you bought this!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd one I've owned. My boyfriend confiscated my first one. I donated my second one to my daughter and frankly I can't live without one. Real Estate agents should give one to each home owner for every property they sell. It's well made, strong, practical, convenient, and folds up and down effortlessly. A child's stroller is more difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Toni H.

customer_reviews.title: Few quirks - great overall.
customer_reviews.text: This is actually brilliantly designed. It’s solid and we’ll built. I’m genuinely impressed and that doesn’t happen often with stuff purchased from Amazon. The opening is straightforward. The folding and closing could use some re-engineering. Also the nuts on the bottom a feel could be more flush. Also could use and easier way to handle hold while folded as it’s not the lightest nor the easiest to carry folded. Al in all - great cart. Very well thought out.
customer_reviews.author: battleship

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly marvelous!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is wow! Never has ANYTHING been this easy. It is totally assembled. It is strong and I was using it two minutes after taking it out of the box. It took me two minutes to get over the shock of it being so ready to use and nothing to assemble! It turns on a dime very easily. Gosh I am impressed. I think I am going to buy a couple more and have them dedicated for certain jobs in different areas. It is not heavy at all and you might think well it cannot be sturdy....but it is. Good job!
customer_reviews.author: J. Rivera

customer_reviews.title: The Magna Cart Flatform is a very impressive light-duty folding platform cart
customer_reviews.text: The Magna Cart Flatform is fast and easy to unfold for use and fold for storage - unlike the Cosco Shifter that I returned. If you don't need the upright hand truck mode of the Shifter IMO the Flatform a far better choice for light duty moving. Large wheels handle most door thresholds easily. Some parts are plastic so the 300 lb. rating seems a bit of a stretch...
customer_reviews.author: C. Platt

customer_reviews.title: Save your back!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why I didn't get this cart earlier? It's an awesome and very sturdy cart, Get this instead of carrying stuff and hurting your back. The wheels are rubberized and very smooth. The only thing I don't like about it, and the reason I took 1 star out. Is that it's bulky and heavy. I don't regret getting the bigger one as you can carry more stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Little Cart, Folds Flat....
customer_reviews.text: This little cart is great!!! I’m very nerdy and did a lot of research and read tons of reviews...This has the highest reviews per total reviewed... It also had the best design, folding complete flat with the wheels facing in so the dirty wheels are not touching anything when stored in your car or closet. The cart is sturdy holds a lot and is pretty smooth rolling around. I highly recommend even just for the fact it folds completely flat; very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: MarylandNCB

customer_reviews.title: Great for flat surfaces
customer_reviews.text: This cart is nice, but its platform is very small. It doesn't hold my larger plastic tubs very well. If you are only moving a couple medium size tubs, then this will work fine. It's not great for going over rocks and grass though. It does fold up fairly easily. The extendable handle is nice, though I wish it were a little longer. At 5'5, I feel it's a little short, so if you are tall, you will be bending over slightly in order to use this.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: very helpful cart
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cart to help with a move and it was invaluable. It folds up flat so I could put it right behind the seat in the car. There were other carts available but they make a lot more noise when pulling them down the hall. This one turned out to be great. Good value for the money
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Mine was Broken
customer_reviews.text: This product has not work since I received it. I loaded my items onto the cart and one if the wheels collapsed. After getting help I was able to load my items and get them in the building but coming out, it collapsed again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Cart works great for a college student. My college student used it to move from one dorm room to another, and uses it to collect bigger packages from the mail office. It easily folds open and close. Just be sure to keep your fingers away from the folding/moving parts when doing so.
customer_reviews.author: zaphod42

customer_reviews.title: GOOD LITTLE CART!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cart to move heavy bins of recyclable paper. The only problem is the steerable wheels are located by the front of the cart instead of at the handle. If you try pushing the cart the front end wanders all over place. The only recourse is to pull the cart instead. Which works better but you cant see the stuff loaded on the platform unless you constantly look over your shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: Just me.

customer_reviews.title: great updated cart
customer_reviews.text: I am over 65 yo and have arthritis and had a rotator cuff repaired last year. I still get my cardio and lift small weights and bands, but did not want to schlepp across the parking lot with groceries. I put a plastic box on the bed of the cart and put all of the groceries inside . I used a bungee cord to keep it from falling off. It works great!!! Havent tried to go up steps with it, and since I am in the first floor in a condo; I am lucky to not havet to , so I dont know how it would work on steps. It is great for water packs and all my groceries.
customer_reviews.author: CHERYL BUSCH

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product. Speedy delivery.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! I bought this for my daughter's upcoming move into her apartment. It will help ease the burden of carrying groceries and heavy objects from her car to her apartment. It is well-made. No assembly required. It folds up to nothing. Perfect for storing in small spaces.
customer_reviews.author: E.E

customer_reviews.title: Must have for anyone!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for almost anyone. Perfect for moving or even a large grocery store trip! I love how easy it is to fold down and it’s not very heavy to carry and it even has a hand hold at one of the ends and it does fold up pretty flat including the wheels!
customer_reviews.author: roamieboy

customer_reviews.title: Compact, Sturdy and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely impressed with this item. It took a bit for me to figure out how to fold and unfold, although the directions are on the unit. Once I figured it out I felt like this would have been so helpful on so many occassions had I had it before. I liked to shop at stores that only offer huge carts and flat beds. I can use this instead. It's strong and sturdy and compact. The wheels are coated so they are smooth, won't get chewed up.
customer_reviews.author: A. L. W.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and stupid easy to open.
customer_reviews.text: What a super simple thing to use. Just take out of box and lift the handle and the wheels pop into position. That’s it ready to use. 5 seconds. Seems sturdy and wheels are 2 fixed and 2 swivel. Wheels were smooth and rolled easily. Can fold flat for storage. It’s not that big so make sure it’s the size you need. For me it was perfect to help move and unload the heavy things from a moving van.
customer_reviews.author: Question everything

customer_reviews.title: Ditto what everyone else said
customer_reviews.text: I was needing to empty a storage unit on my own, plus I needed a better one than I have for condo living--picking up packages from mailroom, bringing up purchases like small furniture, etc. This is working great even with 4 x-large size plastic bins filled with clothes, books, fabric piled onto it. The wheel movement is just lovely. Since it folds easily into this perfect small flat package, I will just keep it in my car-- I'm almost 60 and piles of packages and groceries seem to get heavier every day LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Janie

customer_reviews.title: This is easy to handle and has a lot of uses.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these carts about 5 years ago, and loved it. I use that one to move my lemon tree in and out of the house as the seasons change. When I needed something to help me move boxes around the house after a recent move, I searched online for the same cart and was thrilled to find it on Amazon. Even though I’m older, have arthritis, and am short, I am able to open and close it and move it around. It’s versatile, and the quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie 30281

customer_reviews.title: Extremely versatile!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th one I have bought. They hold up very well and I use them constantly. I'm 60 yrs old and I travel for work. I will use it to load and unload my car when checking into a hotel. I use it to haul around my tool bag and small things on the job. Really a good investment!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S. Morehead

customer_reviews.title: An efficient cart.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good cart. It rolls smoothly and is easy to maneuver. I do wish it had some sort of break because it has a tendency like all carts to roll away on an incline. The cart easy to store due to it being lightweight. Lastly, it is sturdy and comes assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Ed F.

customer_reviews.title: Great little cart.
customer_reviews.text: Falling in the gap of handtruck dollies and magliners, these compact carts are super sturdy and really useful (so useful I've got 4 of these). Glides smoothly on solid rubber wheels (with smart wheels below the handle). Folds up nicely. Easy to carry. Nice to leave in the car and great for carting around flats of water, boxes, what have you. The current version has an updated handle covering which is hard rubber instead of soft foam.
customer_reviews.author: bigninja

product_meta.title: Magna Cart Flatform 300 lb Capacity Four Wheel Folding Platform Truck
product_meta.description:
Size Name:300 lbMagna (FF) Cart Flatform Platform 4 Wheeled Hand Truck Description Patented, 4-wheeled Platform Truck/Dolly. Folds Down to 3- by 27 inches and fits virtually anywhere for storage. Weighs less than 14.8 pounds so you can take it easily with you on your travels, too. It takes only seconds to open and close. Rated to 275 pounds Major plastic stress points are made of ultra-durable nylon; other plastic pieces are polypropylene. Tubing material of aluminum and stainless steel for the most durable, lightweight backbone ever devised for a platform hand truck. The plate size is 26.8 inches long by 16.1 inches wide. The Magna Cart Flatform is an innovative 4-wheeled platform truck that is rated to 300 lbs. and folds down to only 27in.L x 3in.D for easy storage. Opens and closes in seconds. Reinforced polypropylene platform with aluminum/stainless steel frame; rolls on 4 3/4in. nonmarring gray rubber tires. Load Capacity (lbs.): 300, Platform Size L x W (in.): 26 13/16 x 16, Wheel Size (in.): 4 3/4, Wheel Type: Rubber Features Fully folding 4-wheeled platform truck compacts to 3î thin and less than 27î tall for storage anywhere Holds up to 275 lbs Surface size 26.8" length x 16.1" wide 4 x 4.75î non-marring, grey wheels provide 4-point stability; front wheels rotate 360 degrees for maneuverability Ships in Certified Frustration-Free Packaging Manufacturer Warranty: 12 months parts / 12 months labor

AMAZON.COM
Patented, 4-wheeled Platform Truck/Dolly. Folds Down to 3- by 27 inches and fits virtually anywhere for storage. Weighs less than 14.8 pounds so you can take it easily with you on your travels, too. It takes only seconds to open and close. Rated to 275 pounds Major plastic stress points are made of ultra-durable nylon; other plastic pieces are polypropylene. Tubing material of aluminum and stainless steel for the most durable, lightweight backbone ever devised for a platform hand truck. The plate size is 26.8 inches long by 16.1 inches wide. 

Certified Frustration-Free Packaging
Amazon.com has certified this product's packaging is Frustration-Free. A Frustration-Free Package is easy-to-open and comes without excess packaging materials such as hard plastic "clamshell" casings, plastic bindings, and wire ties. It is exactly the same as a traditionally packaged product--we've just streamlined the packaging to be opened without the use of a box cutter or knife and will protect your product just as well as traditional packaging during shipping. Products with Frustration-Free Packaging can frequently be shipped in their own boxes, without the need for an additional shipping box. Learn more.
feature_bullets: The Magna Cart Flatform folding four wheel platform cart can be taken and stored anywhere!
Telescoping handle extends to 36", large 27" x 16" platform and 4" rubber wheels (no air required) is capable of carrying up to 300 lbs.
Opens and Closes in seconds, folds flat to only 3.5" thick for easy storage and transportation.
Non-marring wheels provide 4-point stability; front wheels rotate 360 degrees for maneuverability. Works well with Magna Cart MT3 Collapsible Storage Totes
The Magna Cart Flatform folding four wheel platform cart can be taken and stored anywhere!
Telescoping handle extends to 36”, large 27“ x 16” platform and 4" rubber wheels (no air required) is capable of carrying up to 300 lbs.
Opens and Closes in seconds, folds flat to only 3.5" thick for easy storage and transportation.
Non-marring wheels provide 4-point stability; front wheels rotate 360 degrees for maneuverability. Works well with Magna Cart MT3 Collapsible Storage Totes
